oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Physical and mental preparedness for large animal practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: zur Linden, Emily
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: grip strength
habits
stress

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Veterinary medicine, specifically large animal practice, is a highly physical job with inherent physical danger. Being in good physical shape and cultivating good fitness habits can de足crease our risk of injury. Physical fitness will affect our perfor足mance. For example, measurements of grip strength have been shown to be indicative of accuracy in transrectal bovine palpa足tion pregnancy diagnosis at the student level. This session also covers acute and chronic stress and tools we can use to com足plete stress cycles.
